title: 820-00145 A1534
message: The device is charging, but the USB is not working. The USB voltage indicator does not light up at all. I tried using a flash drive, but its light is also not turning on, indicating that there is no USB 5V power. Where should I check next? I have already tested the DC socket and the intermediate flex cable.

title: 820-00145 A1534
message: By the way, I tested it using a USB-C to USB converter.

title: 820-00145 A1534
message: On the J4700, pins 2 and 52 should have a stable voltage of 5V. The fluctuation you are experiencing, ranging from 0.80V to 1.1V, suggests that there may be an issue with the power supply or the circuitry related to those pins. It is important for these pins to have a consistent 5V voltage for proper USB functionality. I recommend further troubleshooting or consulting a technician to diagnose and resolve the issue.

title: 820-00145 A1534
message: "The voltage value on pins 2 and 52 of the J4700 is not stable; it fluctuates between 0.80V, 0.90V, and 1.1V. Shouldn't there be a constant 5V here?"

title: 820-00145 A1534
message:
I suppose you have 820-00045 board in fact.

An USB device is powered from L7850; through U7860/65, depending which way the device is connected.

title: 820-00145 A1534
message:
820-00045  Yes

PP5V1_S4SW : 5 volt
PP5V1_S4SW_CC1/CC2   :   not stable; it fluctuates between 0.80V, 0.90V, and 1.1V. 
u7860 Is the u7860 faulty?

If I jumper between PP5V1_S4SW and PP5V1_S4SW_CC1 will it work?
Will it work if I connect PP5V1_S4SW with PP5V1_S4SW_C?  :)

title: 820-00145 A1534
message:
Only one of U7860/65 works at a time; depending of the connection way.

Check BBPD_VCONN1/2_EN signals.
At least one should be high, when external USB device is connected.
If not, change U4700.

If use USB-C hub, then power it externally.
